qas.question: How do people create a social reality in which social categorization is achieved?

answers.text: define and talk about a particular conception of race

qas.question: What can be said to be a social construct?
What contexts do racial social constructs develop within?
Constructs may be the result rather than the inciter of what?
What effect does race have in the lives of people?

context: When people <a0_0>define and talk about a particular conception of race<a0_0/>, they create a social reality through which social categorization is achieved. In this sense, <a1_0>races<a1_0/> are said to be social constructs. These constructs develop within various <a2_0>legal, economic, and sociopolitical<a2_0/> contexts, and may be the effect, rather than the cause, of <a3_0>major social situations<a3_0/>. While race is understood to be a social construct by many, most scholars agree that race has <a4_0>real material<a4_0/> effects in the lives of people through institutionalized practices of preference and discrimination.
